resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
KevinGre@KevinGreLapX:~/Python$ bin/python
Python 3.5.2 |Continuum Analytics, Inc.| (default, Jul  2 2016, 17:53:06)
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pyarrow
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/KevinGre/Python/lib/python3.5/site-packages/pyarrow/__init__.py", line 28, in <module>
    from pyarrow.lib import cpu_count, set_cpu_count
ImportError: /home/KevinGre/Python/lib/python3.5/site-packages/pyarrow/../../.././libjemalloc.so.2: cannot allocate memory in static TLS block
fields.summary: on import get libjemalloc.so.2: cannot allocate memory in static TLS block

comments.body:
Let me know what info you need to repro. This occurs running in a Ubuntu 16.04 based data science VM in Azure. Also repros using the Linux sub-system on windows (Bash on windows). Some details from a coda info:
/Python/bin/conda info
Current conda install:

               platform : linux-64
          conda version : 4.2.12
       conda is private : False
      conda-env version : 4.2.12
    conda-build version : not installed
         python version : 3.5.2.final.0
       requests version : 2.11.1
       root environment : /home/kevingre/Python  (writable)
    default environment : /home/kevingre/Python
       envs directories : /home/kevingre/Python/envs
          package cache : /home/kevingre/Python/pkgs
           channel URLs : https://repo.continuum.io/pkgs/free/linux-64
                          https://repo.continuum.io/pkgs/free/noarch
                          https://repo.continuum.io/pkgs/pro/linux-64
                          https://repo.continuum.io/pkgs/pro/noarch
                          https://conda.anaconda.org/conda-forge/linux-64
                          https://conda.anaconda.org/conda-forge/noarch
            config file : /home/kevingre/Python/.condarc
           offline mode : False
Can you let us know if downgrading to jemalloc=4.4.0 makes the problem go away?

downgrading jemalloc does permit the import to complete:
jemalloc: 5.0.0-0 conda-forge --> 4.4.0-0 conda-forge
OK, in the meantime I've suggested disabling static TLS in the jemalloc 5.0.0 in conda-forge https://github.com/conda-forge/jemalloc-feedstock/issues/3
Should I expect to need to downgrade on all platforms (windows. mac)? Any guidance on when I will need to set the specific version of jemalloc to avoid this issue?
Depending on the outcome of the discussion on the issue I linked we will either fix the 5.0.0 package or update pyarrow to be pinned on 4.4.0
This should be resolved now, can you confirm all is OK with jemalloc 5.0.0?
Wes, looks like I need to enlist and build to test 0.5.0. Is there an easier options (other drop point perhaps)? If not, I'll look at the build option.
I updated the jemalloc conda-forge package which should have fixed the problem, so you can verify with the 0.4.1 pyarrow from conda-forge

After bin/conda install pyarrow jemalloc
which did:
jemalloc: 4.4.0-0 conda-forge --> 5.0.0-1 conda-forge
parquet-cpp: 1.1.0-2           conda-forge --> 1.2.0.pre-0       conda-forge
pyarrow:     0.4.0-np111py35_0 conda-forge --> 0.4.1-np111py35_0 conda-forge
I still repro the problem.

retried with 
bin/conda  uninstall -c conda-forge  pyarrow jemalloc
bin/conda  install -c conda-forge  pyarrow jemalloc

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    arrow-cpp:   0.4.1-np111py35_2 conda-forge
    jemalloc:    5.0.0-1           conda-forge
    parquet-cpp: 1.2.0.pre-0       conda-forge
    pyarrow:     0.4.1-np111py35_0 conda-forge

still failed to import pyarrow. Am I missing something?
Nope. I'm able to repro the problem now after some twiddling, so I will try to sort out a resolution
[~xhochy] I'm going to pin arrow-cpp in conda-forge on jemalloc 4.4.0 until we understand how to fix this with 5.0.0
We've removed the jemalloc 5.0.0 conda-forge packages so we should be good to go now
Verified that installing pyarrow (0.4.0 or 0.4.1) does now only pull jemalloc 4.4.0-0.
